p: In patients recovered from COVID-19, antibodies to the receptor-binding domain of the spike protein and the nucleocapsid protein were detected by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) 14Â days following the onset of symptoms; ELISA antibody titers correlated with neutralizing activity [ 23]. One preliminary study reported that rhesus macaques infected with SARS-CoV-2 did not develop reinfection following recovery and re-challenge [ 24]; however, this study has not been published in a peer-reviewed journal, and further confirmation of these findings is needed.
